channel.title: Place and Delete Objects! Help Please!
channel.description: Hi everyone, I'm trying to delete some objects in my server but it wont succeed me! Even i try to place some object but even that wont succeed. I hope that somebody can help me! Al ready thanks Gratz Masterthom

item.title: Place and Delete Objects! Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Masterthom Masterthom
item.description:
@Masterthom wrote:

[quote=“dirtynife, post:6, topic:294736”]Ok…

Adding global objects…

  1. Go to client.java and search for “makeglobal”
  2. When your there… Copy one and repaste it underneath it.
  3. Go in your server and go to where you want it to be and type ::mypos.
  4. X and Y cords will show up.
  5. Replace those cords from the one you copied.
  6. Now lets say you wanna make… Rune ore? You will get its id and replace it with number that is after the 2nd coma.
    Exemple; makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 2473, 0, 10);
    x , y , id , 0, 10

Ok? If you didn’t understand just ask.

Have a good day! :D![/quote]
Yeah, i go try it but its not really clear to me :$. So yeah do you want to give me more instructions. ^^[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2009, 12:46:44 pm[/size][hr]The compile bestand doesn’t work if i start it it says: Can not find the path. Or something… So what did i have to do now ??

Read full topic

item.title: Place and Delete Objects! Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @dirtynife dirtynife
item.description:
@dirtynife wrote:

Ok…

Adding global objects…

  1. Go to client.java and search for “makeglobal”
  2. When your there… Copy one and repaste it underneath it.
  3. Go in your server and go to where you want it to be and type ::mypos.
  4. X and Y cords will show up.
  5. Replace those cords from the one you copied.
  6. Now lets say you wanna make… Rune ore? You will get its id and replace it with number that is after the 2nd coma.
    Exemple; makeGlobalObject(3097, 3107, 2473, 0, 10);
    x , y , id , 0, 10

Ok? If you didn’t understand just ask.

Have a good day! :D!

Read full topic

item.title: Place and Delete Objects! Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @dirtynife dirtynife
item.description:
@dirtynife wrote:

Ok…

Deleting stuff

  1. Go to client.java and search for “deletethat”
  2. When your there… Copy one and repaste it underneath it.
  3. Get the cords of the object you wanna delete.
  4. Replace the cords from the one you copied and save but do not close.
  5. Compile. Run.bat and see if it works.

Read full topic
